title: Using the Product Property.
text: Use the Product Property first: $$\log_{a}\left(M N\right)$$ $$=$$ $$\log_{a}\left(M\right)$$ + $$\log_{a}\left(N\right)$$.
speech: Use the Product Property first:  the log base a of, parentheses   m   n,    is equal to  , the log base a of   m,  + , the log base a of   n .

+  , the log base a of   n

title: Applying the Product Property to this problem.
speech: Here, the Product Property gives  the log base 2 of 5,  +  the log base 2 of, parentheses x to the fourth   + , the log base 2 of, parentheses y squared  .

title: Using the Power Property.
speech: Use the Power Property next:  the log base a of, parentheses   m to the p-th,    is equal to,  , p times the log base a of   m .

, p times the log base a of   m

title: Applying the Power Property to this problem.
text: Here, the Power Property on $$\log_{2}\left(x^4\right)$$ + $$\log_{2}\left(y^2\right)$$ gives $$4*\log_{4}\left(x\right)$$ + $$2*\log_{4}\left(y\right)$$
speech: Here, the Power Property on  the log base 2 of, parentheses x to the fourth   + , the log base 2 of, parentheses y squared   gives , 4 times the log base 4 of x  + , 2 times the log base 4 of y

+  , the log base 2 of,  y squared
gives  , 4 times the log base 4 of x
+  , 2 times the log base 4 of y

title: Putting it all together.
text: The previous steps leave the equation $$\log_{2}\left(5\right)+4*\log_{2}\left(x\right)+2*\log_{2}\left(y\right)$$.
speech: The previous steps leave the equation  the log base 2 of 5, plus, 4 times the log base 2 of x plus, 2 times the log base 2 of y .
